Sure! Let's identify the "Disease" entities in the given paragraph.

1. Nephrotic syndrome - This is a disease characterized by a group of symptoms including proteinuria (excessive protein in the urine), hypoalbuminemia (low levels of albumin in the blood), edema (swelling), and hyperlipidemia (high levels of lipids in the blood). It is considered a disease entity.

2. Renal failure - This is a condition where the kidneys are unable to adequately filter waste products from the blood. It can be acute or chronic and is considered a disease entity.
